channel.title: This doesnt seem to be working

item.title: This doesnt seem to be working
item.dc:creator: @Pwnd Pwnd
item.description:
@Pwnd wrote:

[quote=“R.I.P RSC, post:12, topic:246436”]With all due respect, why would you want to do this? Just develop your new site on your own pc, and then upload it to your server. This will completely prevent security issues, that you’ll find when testing your site. If you put it on the web before making sure it’s safe, you can be into a shit load of troubles. N00b1 was nice the last time, but there are others that won’t be.[/quote]You can do this by having a secure part on your websever, if you don’t wish to install a server on your home machine.
Just a suggestion, I know someone would take that as me bashing them.

Read full topic
item.source: This doesnt seem to be working

item.title: This doesnt seem to be working
item.dc:creator: @runescape3dude runescape3dude
item.description:
@runescape3dude wrote:

Moparisthebest:

First, make sure 'Location: ’ starts with a capital ‘L’, then start the URL with ‘http://’ and it should work.

It does not need to be capital. It does not need to start with http:// you can just do header(“location: …/file”);

Read full topic

item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

With all due respect, why would you want to do this? Just develop your new site on your own pc, and then upload it to your server. This will completely prevent security issues, that you’ll find when testing your site. If you put it on the web before making sure it’s safe, you can be into a shit load of troubles. N00b1 was nice the last time, but there are others that won’t be.

item.title: This doesnt seem to be working
item.dc:creator: @I_james_I I james I
item.description:
@I_james_I wrote:

[quote=“runescape3dude, post:6, topic:246436”][quote author=I james I link=topic=322909.msg2551203#msg2551203 date=1227551337]

<?php if($_SERVER['REMOTE_ADDR'] != "IP") { header("Location: http://google.com"); } ?>

no change

is there a way to do it via htaccess?
[/quote]
I don’t know. I think there is.

Try changing it to REMOTE_HOST or something.[/quote]

to website link maybe?

etc:

<?php if(www.sitename.com/anydirectory != "IP") { header("Location: http://google.com"); } ?>

item.title: This doesnt seem to be working
item.dc:creator: @imjohn10 imjohn10
item.description:
@imjohn10 wrote:

Works fine for me. Are you sure you have your IP correct.

<?php $allowed_ip = array('127.0.0.1'); if (!in_array($_SERVER['REMOTE_ADDR'], $allowed_ip)) { header("location: http://www.google.com"); } ?>

Read full topic
item.source: This doesnt seem to be working

item.title: This doesnt seem to be working
item.dc:creator: @I_james_I I james I
item.description:
@I_james_I wrote:

Hello!

I was wanting a underconstruction script for my site, so it redirects the user to a certain page unless you add an ipaddress.
I made this:

<?php $allowed_ip = array('my.ip.address.here'); if (!in_array($_SERVER['REMOTE_ADDR'], $allowed_ip)) { header("location: www.sitename.net/construction.php"); } ?>

It doesnt seem to be working.

Any ideas?
Thanks

Read full topic
